title: Mississippi Fried Chicken
ingredients: 8 pieces of chicken, thighs, breasts, etc.
1 cup flour, seasoned with salt, pepper, and sweet paprika
instructions: Combine the milk and the Tabasco Sauce.  Pour the mixture over the chicken, and let the chicken stand in the mixture, turning occasionally, for 1 hour.

Place the seasoned flour in a bag.  Drain the chicken and place it, two pieces at a time, in the bag containing the seasoned flour.  Shake the bag to coat the chicken well with the seasoned flour.  Remove the chicken pieces, shake off the excess flour, and set aside until the remaining pieces are also coated and ready.

In a large, deep skillet, fry the dark meat chicken pieces first, in 1½ inches of 350° F. oil, turning them, for 3 minutes.  Transfer the fried chicken pieces to paper towels and allow them to drain.  Add the white meat pieces and fry them for 12 minutes or until they are well browned.  As before, transfer the fried pieces of chicken to paper towels to drain.
Source:  You Asked for It, Gourmet Magazine, July 1984.
